data.enText: cuss
a rude or offensive word or phrase that some people use when they are very angry

data.chText: 他低声咒骂另一位开车的人。
data.enText: He muttered a curse at the other driver.
a word or phrase that has a magic power to make sth bad happen

data.chText: 这家人认为他们受人诅咒而遭了殃。
data.enText: The family thought that they were under a curse .
something that causes harm or evil
the curse of drug addiction

data.chText: 噪音是现代城市生活的一大祸根。
data.enText: Noise is a curse of modern city life.
to swear

data.chText: 他站起来时撞了头，便破口大骂。
data.enText: He hit his head as he stood up and cursed loudly.
to say rude things to sb or think rude things about sb/sth
She cursed her bad luck.
He cursed himself for his stupidity.
to use a magic word or phrase against sb in order to harm them

data.chText: 传说整座村庄遭到了巫婆的诅咒。
data.enText: Legend has it that the whole village had been cursed by a witch.
be cursed with sth

data.chText: 不断因…而遭殃；为…所苦；受…之害
data.enText: to continuously suffer from or be affected by sth bad

data.chText: 她好像运气不好连连遭殃。
data.enText: She seems cursed with bad luck.
be cursed with sth

data.chText: 不断因…而遭殃；为…所苦；受…之害
data.enText: to continuously suffer from or be affected by sth bad

data.chText: 她好像运气不好连连遭殃。
data.enText: She seems cursed with bad luck.

tr: profane or obscene expression usually of surprise or anger

example: a witch put a curse on his whole family
he put the whammy on me

tr: an appeal to some supernatural power to inflict evil on someone or some group

example: The drunken men were cursing loudly in the street
The bad witch cursed the child
The taxi driver who felt he didn't get a high enough tip cursed the passenger

tr: exclude from a church or a religious community
example: The gay priest was excommunicated when he married his partner

value.def: If you curse, you use rude or offensive language, usually because you are angry about something.

example.ex: I cursed and hobbled to my feet.
example.tran: 我咒骂着一瘸一拐地站起来。

example.ex: He shot her an angry look and a curse.
example.tran: 他生气地看了她一眼，骂了一句。

value.def: If you curse someone, you say insulting things to them because you are angry with them.

example.ex: Grandma protested, but he cursed her and rudely pushed her aside...
example.tran: 奶奶提出抗议，但他辱骂她并把她粗暴地推到一旁。

example.ex: He cursed himself for having been so careless.
example.tran: 他骂自己怎么那么不小心。

value.def: If you curse something, you complain angrily about it, especially using rude language.

example.ex: So we set off again, cursing the delay, towards the west...
example.tran: 于是，我们一面抱怨延误了时间，一面又朝西出发了。

example.ex: She silently cursed her own stupidity.
example.tran: 她在心里默默地骂自己愚蠢。

value.tran: (尤指用粗话)抱怨，发牢骚;咒骂

value.def: If you say that there is a curse on someone, you mean that there seems to be a supernatural power causing unpleasant things to happen to them.

example.ex: Maybe there is a curse on my family...
example.tran: 可能我的家族受到了诅咒。

example.ex: He's been the object of a voodoo curse.

value.def: You can refer to something that causes a great deal of trouble or harm as a curse .

example.ex: Apathy is the long-standing curse of British local democracy...
example.tran: 冷漠是英国地方民主制度长期以来难以推广的祸根。

example.ex: Summer colds are a terrible curse.
example.tran: 夏季感冒是极其糟糕的事。
